zh: 洗手间在哪里？

en: The constitution was amended so that women could vote.
zh: 宪法经过修正，妇女可以投票。

en: She smiled at me with friendly brown eyes.
zh: 她用友善的棕色眼睛对我微笑。

en: The lady tolerated the man.
zh: 那位女士容忍了那个男人。

en: You must take off your hats in the presence of ladies.
zh: 在女士面前你必须脱帽。

en: There are many careers open to women.
zh: 现在有很多职业向女性开放。

en: It's so nice to be by ourselves.
zh: 我们自己在一起真好。

en: It is good to feel that nothing can come between a man and wife.
zh: 感觉到夫妻之间没有任何隔阂是件好事。

en: The couple quarreled, but soon made up.
zh: 这对夫妇吵架了，但很快就和好了。

en: The relationship between husband and wife should be based on love.
zh: 夫妻之间的关系应该建立在爱的基础上。

en: The couple separated, never to see each other again.
zh: 这对夫妇分开了，再也没有见过面。

en: Husbands and wives should stand by each other throughout their lives.
zh: 夫妻应该一生互相扶持。

en: Husbands and wives should help each other as long as they live.
zh: 夫妻应该一生互相帮助。

en: The couple decided to adopt an orphan.
zh: 这对夫妇决定收养一个孤儿。

en: Married couples can apply for the post.
zh: 已婚夫妇可以申请这个职位。

en: No one in his right mind wants anything to do with a domestic quarrel.
zh: 神志清醒的人都不会想管家务事。

en: It is quite natural the couple should love each other.
zh: 这对夫妇彼此相爱是很自然的。

en: The couple put their house on the market.
zh: 这对夫妇把他们的房子挂牌出售了。

en: The couple transformed chemistry into a modern science.
zh: 这对夫妇将炼金术转变为现代科学。

en: She has gone to the bad since she lost her husband.
zh: 自从她失去丈夫后，她就变坏了。

en: A woman whose husband has died is a widow.
zh: 丈夫去世的女人是寡妇。

en: The widowed mother had to go through a lot of hardships.
zh: 这位守寡的母亲不得不经历许多艰难困苦。

en: My husband is indifferent to his clothes.
zh: 我丈夫对他的衣服漠不关心。

en: Her husband demanded that she tell him the whole truth.
zh: 她丈夫要求她告诉他全部真相。

en: My husband has his breakfast while reading the newspaper.
zh: 我丈夫一边看报纸一边吃早餐。

en: My husband reads the newspaper while eating breakfast.
zh: 我丈夫一边看报纸一边吃早餐。

en: My husband is out of work and looking for a job.
zh: 我丈夫失业了，正在找工作。

en: The husband accommodated his plan to his wife's.
zh: 我丈夫使他的计划适应了他妻子的计划。

en: My husband is better able to cook than I.
zh: 我丈夫比我更会做饭。

en: My husband was called away on business.
zh: 我丈夫因公事被叫走了。

en: In contrast to her, her husband didn't seem to be enjoying the shopping.
zh: 与她相比，她的丈夫似乎并不喜欢购物。

en: My husband is in high spirits today.
zh: 我丈夫今天精神很好。

en: Men make houses, women make homes.
zh: 男人建造房子，女人营造家园。

en: It won't be long before my husband comes back.
zh: 我的丈夫很快就会回来了。

en: My husband enjoys his glass once in a while.
zh: 我丈夫偶尔会喝一杯。

en: My husband is always reading in bed.
zh: 我丈夫总是躺在床上看书。

en: My husband earns $100,000 a year.
zh: 我丈夫年收入十万美元。

en: She said that her husband hit her, but in fact it was the other way around.
zh: 她说她丈夫打了她，但事实上正好相反。

en: She took over the business after her husband died.
zh: 她丈夫去世后，她接管了生意。

en: After my husband's death I walked around like a zombie.
zh: 我丈夫去世后，我像行尸走肉一样四处走动。

en: She has lived alone ever since her husband died.
zh: 自从她丈夫去世后，她就一直独自生活。

en: Since her husband's death, she has been living alone.
zh: 自从她丈夫去世后，她就一直独自生活。

en: After her husband's death, she brought up the two children all by herself.
zh: 她丈夫去世后，她独自一人把两个孩子抚养长大。

en: Her husband's health is very precious to her.
zh: 她非常珍惜她丈夫的健康。

en: After her husband's death, she brought up the four children by herself.
zh: 她丈夫去世后，她独自一人把四个孩子抚养长大。

en: It is high time we reconstructed new family relationships and formed a comfortable life.
zh: 我们早就应该重建新的家庭关系，创造舒适的生活了。

en: Her husband's death has tried her severely.
zh: 她丈夫的去世对她打击很大。

en: A woman whose husband is dead is called a widow.
zh: 丈夫去世的女人被称为寡妇。

en: When my husband died, I had a lot of difficulties keeping my chin up.
zh: 我丈夫去世后，我很难振作起来。

en: Compared with her husband, she is not so careful.
zh: 和她丈夫相比，她没那么细心。

en: A lady, whose husband is a famous scientist, came over from the other side.
zh: 一位丈夫是著名科学家的女士从那边过来了。

en: After her husband died, her baby was all in all to her.
zh: 她丈夫去世后，她的孩子就是她的一切。

en: She flared up at the sight of her husband walking with another woman.
zh: 当她看到她丈夫和另一个女人走在一起时，她勃然大怒。

en: She wanted for nothing as long as her husband lived.
zh: 只要她丈夫活着，她就什么都不缺。

en: Her heart broke when her husband died.
zh: 她丈夫去世时，她的心都碎了。

en: When her husband died, she felt like committing suicide.
zh: 她丈夫去世时，她想自杀。

en: When her husband died, she felt like killing herself.
zh: 她丈夫去世时，她想自杀。

en: If only her husband helped her, most of her problems at home would disappear.
zh: 如果她丈夫能帮她，她家里的大部分问题都会消失。

en: My husband sends his best regards to you.
zh: 我丈夫向您致以最诚挚的问候。

en: A good husband makes a good wife.
zh: 好丈夫造就好妻子。

en: A good Jack makes a good Jill.
zh: 好丈夫造就好妻子。(这是一个习语，也可以翻译成：夫妻同心，其利断金。)

en: A man is known by the company he keeps.
zh: 观其交友，知其为人。

en: Please blow your nose prior to seeing me.
zh: 见我之前请先擤鼻涕。

en: I don't mean to be antisocial, but I'm tired.
zh: 我不是故意不合群，只是我太累了。

en: I don't mean to be unsociable, but I'm tired.
zh: 我不是故意不合群，只是我太累了。

en: I am afraid it is a reject.
zh: 恐怕被拒绝了。

en: May I go with you?
zh: 我可以和你一起去吗？

en: The delinquents knocked him down and stole his wallet.
zh: 那些不良少年把他打倒并偷走了他的钱包。

en: Don't spill the beans.
zh: 不要泄露秘密。

en: I would rather be killed than live in disgrace.
zh: 我宁愿被杀死也不愿苟且偷生。

en: Thoughtless speech may give rise to great mischief.
zh: 说话不经大脑可能会引起大麻烦。

en: I can't sleep at night.
zh: 我晚上睡不着。

en: I've no complaints. As far as I'm concerned, everything is just perfect.
zh: 我没有任何抱怨。就我而言，一切都很完美。

en: Discontent abounds in the world.
zh: 世上充满了不满。

en: Some people took hostile attitudes toward the illegal aliens.
zh: 有些人对非法移民采取敌对态度。

en: He puts on a show of being impartial and unbiased, but I think he's just a guy with no opinion of his own.
zh: 他装出一副公正无私的样子，但我认为他只是一个没有自己主见的人。

en: No medicine can cure a man of discontent.
zh: 没有药可以治愈一个人的不满。

en: It is no use complaining.
zh: 抱怨是没有用的。

en: It's no use complaining.
zh: 抱怨是没有用的。

en: There is no cause for complaint.
zh: 没有理由抱怨。

en: It does not become you to complain.
zh: 你不应该抱怨。

en: We have nothing to complain of.
zh: 我们没有什么可抱怨的。

en: We have nothing to complain about.
zh: 我们没有什么可抱怨的。

en: We have no complaints.
zh: 我们没有任何抱怨。

en: I was condemned for my disobedience.
zh: 我因不服从而受到谴责。

en: I've become impotent.
zh: 我变得阳痿了。

en: I'm sterile.
zh: 我不育。

en: I had a tubal ligation.
zh: 我做了输卵管结扎手术。

en: Tokyo landlords are in a panic because the real estate market went soft.
zh: 东京的房东们很恐慌，因为房地产市场疲软了。

en: Real estate agencies have many independent brokers.
zh: 房地产公司有很多独立的经纪人。

en: The real estate industry is in a serious slump, and industry people say the worst is yet to come.
zh: 房地产行业正处于严重的衰退之中，业内人士表示最糟糕的时刻尚未到来。

en: The price of real estate has been rising abnormally in Japan.
zh: 日本的房地产价格一直在异常上涨。

en: I agree with the opinion that real estate is overpriced.
zh: 我同意房地产价格过高的观点。

en: By opening my mouth at the wrong time, I'm always putting myself and my pals behind the eight ball.
zh: 因为在不恰当的时候说话，我总是让自己和我的朋友们陷入困境。

en: We're deeply sorry for the inappropriate remark earlier.
zh: 我们对早先的不当言论深感抱歉。

en: There's no hope at this moment that the closed section will be reopened.
zh: 目前没有希望重新开放关闭的部分。

en: Carelessness was looked on as a serious defect.
zh: 粗心大意被认为是一个严重的缺点。

en: A careless person is apt to make mistakes.
zh: 粗心的人容易犯错误。

en: A careless man often makes mistakes.
zh: 粗心的人经常犯错误。

en: Careless driving causes accidents.
zh: 粗心驾驶会导致事故。

en: Carelessness often causes accidents.
zh: 粗心大意常常导致事故。

en: Carelessness can lead to a serious accident.
zh: 粗心大意可能导致严重的事故。

en: Carelessness often results in accidents.
zh: 粗心大意常常导致事故。

en: He made up the deficit with a loan.
zh: 他用贷款弥补了赤字。

en: I allow for the unexpected.
zh: 我考虑到意外情况。

en: He was dismissed by the company for a misconduct.
zh: 他因行为不端被公司解雇。

en: If you cheat, you run the chance of getting arrested.
zh: 如果你作弊，你就有被逮捕的风险。

en: Cry out against injustice!
zh: 大声疾呼反对不公正！

en: You must speak out against injustice.
zh: 你必须大声疾呼反对不公正。

en: There should be a law against computer hacking.
zh: 应该制定法律来禁止电脑黑客行为。

en: I have an irregular pulse.
zh: 我的脉搏不规律。

en: If you see a suspicious person, please inform the police.
zh: 如果你看到可疑的人，请通知警察。

en: Impure drinking water can be a carrier of diseases.
zh: 不纯净的饮用水可能是疾病的载体。

en: Save money for a rainy day.
zh: 未雨绸缪。

en: You should be prepared for emergencies.
zh: 你应该为紧急情况做好准备。

en: Strange as it may seem, nobody was injured in the fire.
zh: 说来奇怪，火灾中竟然没有人受伤。

en: Strange to say, he did pass the exam after all.
zh: 说也奇怪，他居然还是通过了考试。

en: Strange to say, his prediction has come true.
zh: 说来奇怪，他的预言竟然应验了。

en: Strange to say, the teacher didn't scold me.
zh: 说来奇怪，老师竟然没有批评我。

en: It's strange, but the door opened on its own.
zh: 真奇怪，门竟然自己开了。

en: We happened to meet again through a strange coincidence.
zh: 我们竟然因为一个奇怪的巧合再次相遇。

en: Strangely, I seldom see her.
zh: 奇怪的是，我很少见到她。

en: The strange feeling came back.
zh: 那种奇怪的感觉又回来了。

en: The marvel is that he knew it.
zh: 不可思议的是，他竟然知道这件事。

en: A wonder lasts but nine days.
zh: 好事不出门，坏事传千里。

en: Strangely enough, he failed.
zh: 说也奇怪，他竟然没通过。

en: The drought was blamed for the poor crop.
zh: 干旱是造成作物歉收的原因。

en: The bad harvest caused massive food shortages.
zh: 歉收导致了大规模的食物短缺。

en: Misery loves company.
zh: 同病相怜。

en: Misfortune never come single.
zh: 祸不单行。

en: Let it be on your head!
zh: 后果自负！

en: Misfortunes always come in threes.
zh: 祸不单行。

en: Misfortunes seldom come singly.
zh: 祸不单行。

en: The misery was too much for the readers to keep back their tears.
zh: 读者们看到这种惨状，都忍不住流下了眼泪。

en: Unfortunately she only had five dollars with her.
zh: 不幸的是，她身上只有五美元。

en: Unfortunately, the food supplies gave out before the end of winter.
zh: 不幸的是，食物供应在冬天结束前就用完了。

en: Unfortunately, few passengers survived the catastrophe.
zh: 不幸的是，很少有乘客在这场灾难中幸存下来。

en: He divorced her after years of unhappiness.
zh: 经过多年的不幸福，他与她离婚了。

en: You should try to forget your unhappy past.
zh: 你应该试着忘记你那不愉快的过去。

en: A misfortune befell him.
zh: 他遭遇了不幸。

en: It's not fair! I have to do the hard work!
zh: 这不公平！ 为什么总是要我做苦差事！

en: My way is action not words.
zh: 我的方式是行动，而不是言语。

en: Actions speak louder than words.
zh: 行动胜于雄辩。

en: Deeds, not words.
zh: 行动胜于空谈。

en: Actions speak louder than words. Stop complaining and do it.
zh: 行动胜于雄辩。 别抱怨了，快做吧。

en: Filth breeds illnesses.
zh: 污秽滋生疾病。

en: The unemployment rate went up to 5% because of the recession.
zh: 由于经济衰退，失业率上升到了5%。

en: We're in store for a recession.
zh: 我们即将面临经济衰退。

en: After a slow summer season, business began to pick up.
zh: 在经历了缓慢的夏季之后，生意开始好转。

en: In spite of the depression, the prices of commodities are still high.
zh: 尽管经济不景气，商品价格仍然很高。

en: Even though we're supposedly in a recession, people are traveling abroad in record numbers this Golden Week holiday.
zh: 即使我们正处于经济衰退期，今年黄金周出国旅游的人数也创下了纪录。

en: He said I was his archenemy. How did we arrive at a situation like this?
zh: 他说我是他的头号敌人。 我们是怎么走到今天这一步的？

en: Corporate results deteriorated because of recession.
zh: 由于经济衰退，公司业绩恶化。

en: Depression is a period marked by slackening of business activity, widespread unemployment, falling prices, and wages, etc.
zh: 经济萧条是指商业活动放缓、失业率普遍上升、物价和工资下跌等时期。

en: My business is at a standstill because of the recession.
zh: 由于经济衰退，我的生意停滞不前。

en: The clumsy man envied her unusual talent.
zh: 那个笨拙的男人嫉妒她非凡的才能。

en: I'm afraid I'm frigid.
zh: 恐怕我有性冷淡。

en: The inactive child is far more inclined to live in a world of fantasy.
zh: 不爱活动的孩子更容易生活在幻想的世界里。

en: It's all but impossible.
zh: 这几乎是不可能的。

en: You can't get blood out of a stone.
zh: 你不可能从石头里榨出血来。（比喻：你不可能从一毛不拔的人身上得到任何东西。）

en: Unfortunately the guide went wrong.
zh: 不幸的是，导游走错了路。

en: Unfortunately, Brian met with bad weather.
zh: 不幸的是，布莱恩遇到了恶劣的天气。

en: Apart from being unlucky enough to get ALS, I have been fortunate in almost every other respect.
zh: 除了不幸得了肌萎缩侧索硬化症之外，我在其他方面几乎都是幸运的。

en: Unfortunately, he got his leg broken in the accident.
zh: 不幸的是，他在事故中摔断了腿。

en: It was unfortunate that he lost his passport.
zh: 他丢了护照，真是不幸。

en: I was thrown off guard.
zh: 我被打了个措手不及。

en: Taken by surprise, I couldn't think of anything to say.
zh: 我措手不及，一时语塞。

en: Taken by surprise, I was at a loss for what to answer.
zh: 我措手不及，不知如何回答。

en: Taken by surprise, I could not speak a word.
zh: 我措手不及，一句话也说不出来。

en: A shadow of anxiety swept across her face.
zh: 一丝焦虑掠过她的脸庞。

en: We had a good many anxious moments, but everything turned out all right in the end.
zh: 我们经历了不少焦虑的时刻，但最终一切都好起来了。

en: The bottle smashed to pieces.
zh: 瓶子摔得粉碎。

en: There is very little wine in the bottle, if any.
zh: 瓶子里几乎没有酒，或者说根本没有。

en: Fill the bottle to the top so as to exclude all air.
zh: 把瓶子装满，以排除所有空气。

en: There is a little milk in the bottle.
zh: 瓶子里有一点牛奶。

en: Do it in haste but with care.
zh: 匆忙行事，但要小心谨慎。

en: They love to give parties all the time.
zh: 他们总是喜欢举办派对。

en: You don't have to beat your way.
zh: 你不需要自己开路。

en: Poor men have no leisure.
zh: 穷人没有空闲时间。

en: Poverty is alien to her nature.
zh: 贫穷与她的本性格格不入。

en: Poverty is a pain, but no disgrace.
zh: 贫穷是一种痛苦，但不是耻辱。

en: Poverty is, in a sense, a blessing.
zh: 从某种意义上说，贫穷是一种祝福。

en: Poverty prevented him from attending school.
zh: 贫穷使他无法上学。

en: Poverty drove him to steal.
zh: 贫穷迫使他去偷窃。

en: You say "poor", but there are many degrees of poverty.
zh: 你说“穷”，但贫穷有很多程度。

en: We must provide food and clothes for the poor.
zh: 我们必须为穷人提供食物和衣服。

en: Don't look down on the poor.
zh: 不要看不起穷人。

en: It was the poor who died youngest.
zh: 穷人死得最早。

en: I would buy the car, but I am poor.
zh: 我想买那辆车，但我很穷。

en: If I weren't poor, I'd buy that car.
zh: 如果我不穷，我就买那辆车了。

en: I'm not ashamed that I am poor.
zh: 我不以贫穷为耻。

en: I think being poor is nothing to be ashamed of.
zh: 我认为贫穷没什么可耻的。

en: I'm not ashamed that I'm poor.
zh: 我不以贫穷为耻。

en: Don't be ashamed of being poor.
zh: 不要以贫穷为耻。

en: Poor as he is, he is happy.
zh: 他虽然穷，但他很快乐。

en: Though he is very poor, he is above telling a lie.
zh: 他虽然很穷，但绝不会说谎。

en: Don't despise others because they are poor.
zh: 不要因为别人穷就瞧不起他们。

en: Don't look down on them just because they are poor.
zh: 不要因为他们穷就看不起他们。

en: You should not despise a man because he is poor.
zh: 你不应该因为一个人穷就鄙视他。

en: When a man becomes poor, the beggar in him will come out.
zh: 当一个人变穷时，他内心的乞丐就会显露出来。

en: I don't want to be left holding the bag.
zh: 我不想承担责任。

en: You must not despise a man because he is poorly dressed.
zh: 你不能因为一个人衣着破旧就鄙视他。

en: Poverty is not a bar to happiness.
zh: 贫穷不是幸福的障碍。

en: Want is the mother of industry.
zh: 贫困是勤劳之母。

en: Poverty keeps together more homes than it breaks up.
zh: 贫穷维系的家庭比它破坏的要多。

en: Poverty is still the major cause of crime.
zh: 贫穷仍然是犯罪的主要原因。

en: Poverty often engenders crime.
zh: 贫穷常常会滋生犯罪。

en: Poverty sometimes drives people to commit crimes.
zh: 贫穷有时会驱使人们犯罪。

en: Poverty had taught him to stand on his own feet.
zh: 贫穷教会了他自立。

en: I'm anemic.
zh: 我贫血。

en: I collapsed from anemia.
zh: 我因贫血而晕倒了。

en: Poverty prevented him from continuing his studies.
zh: 贫穷阻止了他继续学业。

en: Illness often results from poverty.
zh: 疾病常常是贫穷造成的。

en: Poor as he was, he would not receive the money.
zh: 他虽然穷，但不会接受这笔钱。

en: What if I am poor?
zh: 我穷又怎么样？

en: Poor as he was, he did not borrow money from others.

zh: 冰正在融化。

en: The ice has melted.
zh: 冰融化了。

en: The ice is too thin to skate on.
zh: 冰太薄了，不能滑冰。

en: Because the ice became soft, we had to call off the ice-skating party.
zh: 因为冰变软了，我们不得不取消滑冰派对。

en: When water freezes and becomes solid, we call it ice.
zh: 当水结冰变成固体时，我们称之为冰。

en: It is hard to keep our balance on icy streets.
zh: 在结冰的街道上很难保持平衡。

en: There's no ice, and in any case it's too cold today for iced tea.
zh: 没有冰了，而且无论如何今天太冷了，不适合喝冰茶。

en: How many samples?
zh: 有多少个样品？

en: The sign indicates the location of the escalator.
zh: 标志指示着自动扶梯的位置。

en: The sign says "Exit."
zh: 标志上写着“出口”。

en: In high altitudes, people find it hard to breathe.
zh: 在高海拔地区，人们觉得呼吸困难。

en: More than a million old people are sick in bed.
zh: 一百多万老人卧病在床。

en: Seeing is believing.
zh: 眼见为实。

en: It will be all the same a hundred years hence.
zh: 一百年后一切都会一样。

en: A hundred years is called a century.
zh: 一百年被称为一个世纪。

en: Few people live to be more than a hundred.
zh: 很少有人能活到一百岁以上。

en: Few people live to be 100 years old.
zh: 很少有人能活到100岁。

en: He died within a few days of his hundredth birthday.
zh: 他在一百岁生日后的几天内去世了。

en: He died a few days before his hundredth birthday.
zh: 他在一百岁生日前几天去世了。

en: Yuri often went to London in those days.
zh: 尤里那时经常去伦敦。

en: The lilies have been beaten down by the rain.
zh: 百合花被雨打倒了。

en: Are you interested in buying an encyclopedia?
zh: 你有兴趣购买百科全书吗？

en: An encyclopedia is a mine of information.
zh: 百科全书是信息的宝库。

en: Get off at Himeji Station.
zh: 在姬路站下车。

en: There are plenty of bridges in Himeji.
zh: 姬路有很多桥。

en: The princess lay with her eyes closed.
zh: 公主闭着眼睛躺着。

en: The present writer doesn't like such a tendency.
zh: 笔者不喜欢这种趋势。

en: I have forgotten to bring something to write with.
zh: 我忘了带写字的东西了。

en: It is not clear what the writer is trying to say.
zh: 作者想说什么并不清楚。

en: There is more water than is needed.
zh: 水太多了，超过了需要的量。

en: Please hand in the necessary papers.
zh: 请提交必要的文件。

en: Don't carry more money than you need.
zh: 不要携带超过你需要的钱。

en: Try not to spend more money than is necessary.
zh: 尽量不要花费超过必要的钱。

en: Do not hand over more money than is necessary to a child.
zh: 不要交给孩子超过必要的钱。

en: There is more money than is needed.
zh: 钱太多了，超过了需要的量。

en: Don't take longer than you need to and come back home quickly.
zh: 不要花太长时间，尽快回家。

en: It is aptly said that necessity is the mother of invention.
zh: 常言道，需要是发明之母。

en: Necessity knows no law.
zh: 需要面前无法律。

en: He makes necessary changes.
zh: 他会做出必要的改变。

en: When it's necessary, you can come to me.
zh: 如果需要，你可以来找我。

en: He can mask his feeling if the occasion calls for it.
zh: 如果场合需要，他可以掩饰自己的感情。

en: Tom said he would draw a map for her if necessary.
zh: 汤姆说如果需要，他会为她画一张地图。

en: I'll come if necessary.
zh: 如果需要，我会来。

en: I will go with you if necessary.
zh: 如果需要，我会和你一起去。

en: If necessary, the government will force estate agents to reduce land prices.
zh: 如果必要，政府将迫使房地产经纪人降低地价。

en: If necessary, I will come soon.
zh: 如果需要，我会尽快来。

en: If it's necessary to do so, I'll pay back my loan now.
zh: 如果必须这样做，我现在就还清贷款。

en: Call me any time, if necessary.
zh: 如果需要，随时给我打电话。

en: It is very important to tell the necessary from the unnecessary.
zh: 分清必要和不必要是非常重要的。

en: We need a square table; not a round one.
zh: 我们需要一张方桌，而不是圆桌。

en: You may ask me any amount of money you need.
zh: 你可以向我索要任何你需要的金额。

en: Keep as many as you need.
zh: 需要多少就留多少。

en: Take only what you need.
zh: 只拿你需要的。

en: The money needed will be given at any time.
zh: 需要的钱随时都会给。

en: Don't waste your money by buying things you don't need.
zh: 不要买不需要的东西浪费钱。

en: I have no objection to paying a special fee if it is necessary.
zh: 如果必要，我不反对支付特别费用。

en: If need be, I will come early tomorrow morning.
zh: 如果需要，我明天早上会早点来。

en: Yamashita is stuck with no way out. His well-thought-out project was rejected and the books he worked really hard on aren't selling.
zh: 山下进退两难。他精心策划的项目被否决了，他努力写的书也卖不出去。

en: You must come without fail.
zh: 你一定要来。

en: Be sure to hand in your homework by tomorrow.
zh: 务必在明天之前交作业。

en: Don't fail to return the book tomorrow.
zh: 明天务必把书还回来。

en: Be sure to call me up tomorrow morning.
zh: 明天早上务必给我打电话。

en: Be sure to fill out the registration form in person.
zh: 务必亲自填写登记表。

en: There is always a next time.
zh: 总会有下一次。

en: It is inevitable that some changes will take place.
zh: 发生一些变化是不可避免的。

en: Never fail to call me up at two o'clock.
zh: 务必在两点钟给我打电话。

en: Don't forget to put your dictionary beside you.
zh: 别忘了把你的字典放在身边。

en: Please be sure to come on time.
zh: 请务必准时来。

en: Don't fail to call me back.
zh: 务必给我回电话。

en: I'll never fail to meet your expectations.
zh: 我绝不会辜负你的期望。

en: I'll do it by all means.
zh: 我一定尽力去做。

en: I'll do that for sure.
zh: 我肯定会那样做。

en: Be sure to pick up some milk.
zh: 务必买些牛奶。

en: Please make sure that the door is locked.
zh: 请务必确认门已锁好。

en: Make sure to turn off the TV.
zh: 务必关掉电视。

en: You will never fail to be moved by the sight.
zh: 你一定会为眼前的景象所感动。

en: Growing children should not always be handled with kid gloves.
zh: 对成长中的孩子不应该总是过分呵护。

en: Be sure to mail this letter.
zh: 一定要把这封信寄出去。

en: Bitter medicine will not necessarily do you good.
zh: 良药未必利于你。

en: Post this card without fail.
zh: 务必把这张卡片寄出去。

en: I will come by all means.
zh: 我一定来。

en: I'll definitely come.
zh: 我肯定会来的。

en: Be sure to come to me by five o'clock.
zh: 务必五点钟之前来找我。

en: By all means, you must come.
zh: 务必请你来。

en: Never fail to come here by five.
zh: 务必五点前到这里。

en: Make sure that you pick me up at five, please.
zh: 请务必五点来接我。

en: Be sure to take the No.2 bus, and get off at 21st Street.
zh: 务必乘坐2路公交车，在21街下车。

en: I'll be there at two o'clock without fail.
zh: 我一定两点到。

en: See to it that all the items are arranged in a row.
zh: 务必把所有物品排成一排。

en: Be sure to fill in the blanks from top to bottom beforehand.
zh: 务必事先从上到下填写空白。

en: See that all the items are arranged in a row.
zh: 务必把所有物品排成一排。

en: Take a seat in the armchair and calm down a while.
zh: 坐在扶手椅上，冷静一会儿。

en: My elbow really hurts. I guess I should go to a hospital.
zh: 我的胳膊肘真的很疼。我想我应该去医院。

en: Bend your knees and look in front of you.
zh: 弯曲你的膝盖，看着前方。

en: Lay the napkin across your lap.
zh: 把餐巾铺在你的膝盖上。

en: I got a shave and a haircut.
zh: 我刮了胡子，理了发。

en: I cut myself while shaving.
zh: 我刮胡子的时候刮伤了自己。

en: I have a head cold.
zh: 我得了感冒。

en: I caught a head cold.
zh: 我得了感冒。

en: You are talking through the nose.
zh: 你说话带着鼻音。

en: I have a runny nose.
zh: 我流鼻涕。

en: Your nose is running.
zh: 你流鼻涕了。

en: My nose is running.
zh: 我流鼻涕了。

en: My nose was very runny.
zh: 我的鼻涕流了很多。

en: The mucus is greenish yellow.
zh: 鼻涕是黄绿色的。

en: I can't stop my nosebleed.
zh: 我止不住鼻血。

en: Don't pick your nose.
zh: 不要挖鼻孔。

en: It's difficult to balance a ball on your nose.
zh: 很难用鼻子平衡一个球。

en: I'm afraid I have a polyp in my nose.
zh: 恐怕我的鼻子里长了息肉。

en: Please breathe through your nose.
zh: 请用鼻子呼吸。

en: I can't breathe through my nose.
zh: 我无法用鼻子呼吸。

en: My nose is stuffed up.
zh: 我的鼻子堵住了。

en: My nose is itchy.
zh: 我的鼻子很痒。

en: I have a stuffed-up nose.
zh: 我鼻子堵了。

en: Miwako, I want you to meet Kenny.
zh: 美和子，我想让你认识一下肯尼。

en: Miyuki has a camera, but she doesn't like it.
zh: 美雪有一个相机，但她不喜欢它。

en: She prides herself on her beauty.
zh: 她以自己的美貌为荣。

en: Beauty is but skin deep.
zh: 美貌不过是表面的。

en: Beauty is only skin deep.
zh: 美貌只是肤浅的。

en: Miho plays the piano.
zh: 美穗弹钢琴。

en: Miho is a pianist.
zh: 美穗是一位钢琴家。

en: Midori sometimes drops consonants.
zh: 绿有时会漏掉辅音。

en: Virtue and vice.
zh: 美德与罪恶。

en: Michiko talks as if she had been to the Arctic herself.
zh: 美智子说话好像她自己去过北极一样。

en: Miyoko carried a torch so long, I think it gave her heartburn.
zh: 美代子举着火把太久了，我想她都烧心了。

en: Miyuki set the table for the party.
zh: 美雪为聚会摆好了桌子。

en: Beautiful women die young - or so the saying goes. If so then my wife is going to live a long life.
zh: 红颜薄命，话虽如此。如果真是这样，那我老婆肯定长命百岁。

en: The saleswoman queried as she wrapped the gloves.
zh: 售货员一边包着手套一边问道。

en: He who has a fair wife needs more than two eyes.
zh: 家有美妻，须防人窥。

en: She's also a beauty.
zh: 她也是个美人。

en: His beautiful wife is his pride.
zh: 他以他美丽的妻子为荣。

en: She wasn't beautiful, but she had big, kind brown eyes and a sweet smile.
zh: 她并不漂亮，但她有一双大大的、善良的棕色眼睛和一个甜美的微笑。

en: She is beautiful.
zh: 她很漂亮。

en: She's beautiful, isn't she?
zh: 她很漂亮，不是吗？

en: Did you go to the art exhibition?
zh: 你去美术展览了吗？

en: The art dealer guaranteed the picture genuine.
zh: 艺术品经销商保证这幅画是真迹。

en: Could you let me off in front of the museum?
zh: 您能让我在博物馆前面下车吗？

en: Where is the bus stop for the museum?
zh: 去博物馆的公共汽车站在哪里？

en: Where is the museum?
zh: 博物馆在哪里？

en: Where's the museum?
zh: 博物馆在哪里？

en: Please put out your cigarettes before entering the museum.
zh: 进入博物馆前请熄灭香烟。

en: How much money has been spent on building the museum?
zh: 建造这座博物馆花了多少钱？

en: Many paintings hang in art museums.
zh: 许多画作悬挂在美术馆里。

en: She went to Paris in order to study art.
zh: 她去巴黎是为了学习艺术。

en: I'm not much of a one for art.
zh: 我对艺术不太感兴趣。

en: Mika is no less charming than Keiko.
zh: 美香和圭子一样有魅力。

en: Beauty is truth, truth beauty.
zh: 美即是真，真即是美。

en: Some say the beauty is more important than virtue.
zh: 有人说美比德更重要。

en: The perception of beauty is a moral test.
zh: 对美的感知是一种道德考验。

en: A thing of beauty is a joy forever.
zh: 美的事物是永恒的喜悦。

en: It was a beautiful sunny day.
zh: 那是一个阳光明媚的美好日子。

en: It seemed to me that beauty was like the summit of a mountain peak; when you had reached it there was nothing to do but to come down again.
zh: 我觉得美就像山峰的顶峰；当你到达顶峰时，除了下山别无他事。

en: We could not help admiring the beautiful sunset.
zh: 我们禁不住赞美那美丽的日落。

en: It's a beautiful day.
zh: 今天天气真好。

en: A beautiful woman was seated one row in front of me.
zh: 一位美丽的女子坐在我前面一排。

en: A beautiful girl sat next to me.
zh: 一个漂亮的女孩坐在我旁边。

en: A fine view burst upon our sight.
zh: 一幅美丽的景色突然映入我们的眼帘。

en: That's beautiful, said John.
zh: 真漂亮，约翰说。

en: John said, "That's a beautiful tune."
zh: 约翰说：“这曲子真好听。”

en: No animal builds beautiful churches, plays tennis, tells jokes, writes songs or visits the moon.
zh: 没有动物会建造美丽的教堂，打网球，讲笑话，写歌或登上月球。

en: Pretty flowers do not necessarily smell sweet.
zh: 漂亮的花不一定香。

en: What is beautiful is not always good.
zh: 美的东西不一定是好的。

en: When I considered beautiful things I found that there was nothing for me to do but to gaze and admire.
zh: 当我思考美好的事物时，我发现我只能凝视和赞美。

en: The emotion they gave me was exquisite, but I could not preserve it, nor could I indefinitely repeat it; the most beautiful things in the world finished by boring me.
zh: 它们给我的情感是精致的，但我无法保存它，也无法无限期地重复它；世界上最美好的事物最终会让我感到厌烦。

en: The fairest rose is at last withered.
zh: 最美的玫瑰最终也会凋谢。

en: Beauty is altogether in the eye of the beholder.
zh: 美完全在于观者的眼中。

en: Beauty is a letter of recommendation which it is almost impossible to ignore.
zh: 美是一封推荐信，几乎不可能被忽视。

en: The beautiful is not always the same as the good.
zh: 美的东西并不总是等同于好的东西。

en: Lake Biwa is the largest lake in Japan.
zh: 琵琶湖是日本最大的湖泊。

en: How deep is Lake Biwa?
zh: 琵琶湖有多深？

en: Lake Biwa came in sight.
zh: 琵琶湖出现在我们的视野中。

en: Minute particles are hardly visible to the naked eye.
zh: 微小的颗粒用肉眼几乎看不见。

en: A smile may convey understanding, joy, or an appreciation of humor.
zh: 微笑可以传达理解、喜悦或对幽默的欣赏。

en: With a smile she dried his hair with a towel.
zh: 她带着微笑用毛巾擦干了他的头发。

en: Keep on smiling.
zh: 保持微笑。

en: Smiles do not always indicate pleasure.
zh: 微笑并不总是表示快乐。

en: Ken is the best guy to communicate with Mr. Ogata. That is, if he prepares presentation materials.
zh: 跟尾形先生沟通的最佳人选是Ken。当然，前提是他准备好演示材料。

en: It's really unbearable to see him looking so down-and-out.
zh: 看到他如此落魄的样子，真是让人难以忍受。

en: Lay up for a rainy day.
zh: 未雨绸缪。

en: When Tobita gives a plan his seal of approval, the client accepts it at first glance.
zh: 一旦户田批准了计划，客户就会立刻接受。

en: An airship is lighter than air.
zh: 飞艇比空气轻。

en: What does an airship look like?
zh: 飞艇是什么样子的？

en: Scarcely had I reached the airport before I realized I had forgotten my ticket.
zh: 我刚到机场就意识到我忘了带机票。

en: How long will the flight time be?
zh: 飞行时间要多久？

en: Some people say that travel by air is rather economical.
zh: 有些人说乘飞机旅行相当经济。

en: The plane crash was only last week.
zh: 飞机失事就发生在上一周。

en: The plane crash took 200 lives.
zh: 飞机失事夺走了200条生命。

en: The news of the air accident left me uneasy.
zh: 空难的消息让我感到不安。

en: Many people were killed in the plane accident.
zh: 许多人在飞机事故中丧生。

en: No one survived the plane crash.
zh: 飞机失事中无人生还。

en: The airplane has brought about a revolution in travel.
zh: 飞机给旅行带来了一场革命。

en: The airplane has robbed travel of its poetry.
zh: 飞机剥夺了旅行的诗意。

en: The plane took off just now.
zh: 飞机刚刚起飞。

en: The plane circled the airport twice after taking off.
zh: 飞机起飞后在机场上空盘旋了两圈。

en: The plane was about to take off.
zh: 飞机就要起飞了。

en: The plane took off and was soon out of sight.
zh: 飞机起飞后很快就消失在视野中。

en: The airplane was just going to take off.
zh: 飞机正要起飞。

en: The plane was grounded because of the fog.
zh: 因为雾，飞机停飞了。

en: The airplane made a safe landing.
zh: 飞机安全着陆。

en: The aeroplane landed safely.
zh: 飞机安全着陆。

en: The airplane landed on my father's farm.
zh: 飞机降落在我父亲的农场上。

en: The plane landed on my dad's farm.
zh: 飞机降落在我爸爸的农场上。

en: The plane flew out of sight.
zh: 飞机飞出了视线。

en: The plane took off at 2:30.
zh: 飞机两点半起飞了。

en: The plane turned eastward.
zh: 飞机转向东方。

en: The airplane sailed over our heads.
zh: 飞机从我们头顶飞过。

en: The plane flew east.
zh: 飞机向东飞去。

en: The plane flew over the island.
zh: 飞机飞越了岛屿。

en: The plane didn't stop at New York.
zh: 飞机没有在纽约停留。

en: The airplane took off on time.
zh: 飞机准时起飞了。

en: The plane took off at 11:00 a.m; thirty minutes later than scheduled.
zh: 飞机上午11点起飞，比计划晚了30分钟。

en: The plane arrived at New York on schedule.
zh: 飞机准时到达纽约。

en: The plane will get in on time.
zh: 飞机将会准时到达。

en: Is the plane on schedule?
zh: 飞机准时吗？

en: The airplane skimmed the ground before it crashed.
zh: 飞机在坠毁前掠过地面。

en: The plane turned sharply to the right just before it crashed.
zh: 飞机在坠毁前猛地向右转弯。

en: Did the plane make up for the lost time?
zh: 飞机赶上延误的时间了吗？

en: The airplane flew very low.
zh: 飞机飞得很低。

en: The airplane was swallowed up in the large clouds.
zh: 飞机被巨大的云层吞没了。

en: The sooner you get your ticket, the cheaper the fare.
zh: 你越早买票，票价就越便宜。

en: The plane increased speed.
zh: 飞机加速了。

en: The plane landed at Narita.
zh: 飞机降落在成田机场。

en: The airplane ascended into the clouds.
zh: 飞机升入云层。

en: The plane went out of sight in a blink.
zh: 飞机一眨眼就不见了。

en: The plane takes off in ten minutes.
zh: 飞机十分钟后起飞。

en: His notion is that planes are safer than cars.
zh: 他的想法是飞机比汽车更安全。

en: He thinks that planes are safer than cars.
zh: 他认为飞机比汽车更安全。

en: The plane put down at Itami Airport on time.
zh: 飞机准时降落在伊丹机场。

en: The plane arrived at Itami Airport on time.
zh: 飞机准时到达伊丹机场。

en: The plane arrived on time.
zh: 飞机准时到达。

en: I wonder if the plane will arrive on time.
zh: 我想知道飞机是否会准时到达。

en: Airplanes are audible long before they are visible.
zh: 飞机在能看见之前很久就能听见。

en: The plane climbed to 4,000 feet.
zh: 飞机爬升到4000英尺。

en: The plane flew over the mountain.
zh: 飞机飞越了山。

en: The plane will arrive at three.
zh: 飞机将于三点到达。

en: The plane is about to take off.
zh: 飞机即将起飞。

en: Does it look like the plane will be crowded?
zh: 看起来飞机上会很拥挤吗？

en: The plane flew away in the direction of Hong Kong.
zh: 飞机朝着香港的方向飞走了。

en: The plane takes off at 8:00 a.m.
zh: 飞机早上八点起飞。

en: The plane took off from Narita at 10 a.m.
zh: 飞机上午十点从成田机场起飞。

en: The plane is due at 7 p.m.
zh: 飞机预计晚上七点到达。

en: The airplane was at the mercy of the strong wind.
zh: 飞机任凭强风摆布。

en: The plane buzzed the control tower.
zh: 飞机掠过控制塔。

en: An airplane touched down on the runway.
zh: 一架飞机在跑道上着陆。

en: Airplanes have made it easy to travel abroad.
zh: 飞机使出国旅行变得容易。

en: What time did the plane arrive at Narita?
zh: 飞机几点到达成田机场？

en: When did the plane land at Narita?
zh: 飞机什么时候降落在成田机场？

en: The plane was lost sight of in the clouds.
zh: 飞机在云层中消失了。

en: The plane is flying above the clouds.
zh: 飞机正在云层上方飞行。

en: The plane flew above the clouds.
zh: 飞机飞过了云层上方。

en: The plane was approaching London.
zh: 飞机正在接近伦敦。

en: Some people say that traveling by plane is rather economical.
zh: 有人说乘飞机旅行相当经济。

en: The airplane soon went out of sight.
zh: 飞机很快就消失在视野中。

en: The plane was on the point of taking off.
zh: 飞机就要起飞了。

en: The plane is about to take off for Paris.
zh: 飞机即将起飞前往巴黎。

en: The plane was blown up by hijackers.
zh: 飞机被劫机者炸毁了。

en: The plane is approaching New York.
zh: 飞机正在接近纽约。

en: The plane landed with a bump.
zh: 飞机颠簸着陆。

en: The plane is just about to start.
zh: 飞机就要启动了。

en: The plane took off exactly at six.
zh: 飞机正好六点起飞。

en: The plane dropped bombs on the city.
zh: 飞机向城市投掷炸弹。

en: The plane had already left the airport.
zh: 飞机已经离开了机场。

en: The plane was soon out of sight.
zh: 飞机很快就消失在视野中。

en: The plane will take off in one hour.
zh: 飞机将在一个小时后起飞。

en: The airplane arrived at 9:03 to the minute.
zh: 飞机在九点零三分准时到达。

en: The plane took off at seven.
zh: 飞机七点起飞。

en: The plane landed at 6 o'clock to the minute.
zh: 飞机在六点准时降落。

en: The plane came in 30 minutes late.
zh: 飞机晚了三十分钟到达。

en: The plane will arrive at the airport thirty minutes late.
zh: 飞机将晚三十分钟到达机场。

en: The plane flew at an altitude of 3,000 meters.
zh: 飞机在三千米的高度飞行。

en: The plane took off one hour behind time.
zh: 飞机晚点一小时起飞。

en: The plane departs from Heathrow at 12:30.
zh: 飞机于十二点三十分从希思罗机场起飞。

en: The plane took off easily.
zh: 飞机顺利起飞。

en: How was your flight?
zh: 你的飞行怎么样？

en: You don't necessarily have to go to the airport to reconfirm your plane reservation.
zh: 你不一定非要去机场重新确认你的飞机预订。

en: I will confirm my plane reservation.
zh: 我将确认我的飞机预订。

en: There was much activity around the plane.
zh: 飞机周围有很多活动。

en: What's the flight's scheduled arrival time?
zh: 航班的预计到达时间是什么时候？

en: The airplane is to arrive at ten o'clock.
zh: 飞机将在十点到达。

en: The plane could easily be late.
zh: 飞机很容易晚点。

en: The speed of an airplane is much greater than that of a helicopter.
zh: 飞机的速度比直升机快得多。

en: Have you already booked our seats on a plane?
zh: 你已经预订了我们在飞机上的座位了吗？

en: It looks like the flight was delayed.
zh: 看起来航班延误了。

en: The plane flew beyond our range of vision.
zh: 飞机飞出了我们的视野范围。

en: We even heard planes.
zh: 我们甚至听到了飞机的声音。

en: You can travel from Osaka to Tokyo in an hour by plane.
zh: 你可以乘坐飞机在一小时内从大阪到东京。

en: Airplanes enable people to travel great distances rapidly.
zh: 飞机使人们能够快速地旅行很远的距离。

en: Airplanes enable us to travel around the world in a few days.
zh: 飞机使我们能够在几天内环游世界。

en: One of the aircraft's engines cut out.
zh: 飞机的一个引擎熄火了。

en: Mr. Sato safely boarded the plane.
zh: 佐藤先生安全地登上了飞机。

en: This is the second time I've flown.
zh: 这是我第二次坐飞机。

en: I missed my flight. Can I get on the next flight?
zh: 我错过了我的航班。我可以搭乘下一班飞机吗？

en: I hurried to the airport lest I should be late for the plane.
zh: 我赶紧去机场，以免误了飞机。

en: I don't want to miss my flight.
zh: 我不想错过我的航班。

en: That was the first time I had flown.
zh: 那是我第一次坐飞机。

en: That was the first time I got on a plane.
zh: 那是我第一次登上飞机。

en: There were 150 passengers on the plane.
zh: 飞机上有150名乘客。

en: I don't like traveling by air.
zh: 我不喜欢乘飞机旅行。

en: Have you ever traveled by plane?
zh: 你曾经乘飞机旅行过吗？

en: Flying enables us go to London in a day.
zh: 乘飞机使我们能够在一天内到达伦敦。

en: Are you going by air or by train?
zh: 你是乘飞机去还是乘火车去？

en: Flying is the quickest way to travel.
zh: 坐飞机是最快的旅行方式。

en: It will cost you more to go by plane.
zh: 坐飞机要花你更多的钱。

en: How much will it cost you to go by air?
zh: 乘飞机要花你多少钱？

en: How long will it take by plane?
zh: 坐飞机要多久？

en: How long does it take to go to Okinawa by plane?
zh: 坐飞机去冲绳要多久？

en: Maybe it's the low air pressure that means you get drunk more easily on planes.
zh: 也许是因为飞机上的气压低，所以更容易喝醉。

en: Flying is the quickest method of travelling.
zh: 坐飞机是最快的旅行方式。

en: We'll fly there in 50 minutes.
zh: 我们将在50分钟内飞到那里。

en: I was very nervous as the plane took off.
zh: 飞机起飞时，我非常紧张。

en: It's natural to be nervous when the plane takes off.
zh: 飞机起飞时感到紧张是很自然的。

en: The plane was about to take off when I heard a strange sound.
zh: 飞机正要起飞时，我听到一个奇怪的声音。

en: The plane exploded and plunged into the ocean, killing all the people on board.
zh: 飞机爆炸并坠入大海，机上所有人员全部遇难。

en: Airplanes have taken the place of electric trains.
zh: 飞机已经取代了电力火车。

en: The airplane fell to the earth.
zh: 飞机坠落到地面。

en: I inquired whether the plane would arrive on time.
zh: 我询问飞机是否会准时到达。

en: The plane flew toward the west.
zh: 飞机向西飞去。

en: I read in the newspaper where contact with the plane had been lost.
zh: 我在报纸上读到，与飞机的联系已经中断。

en: The newspaper said that contact with the plane had been lost.
zh: 报纸上说，与飞机的联系已经中断。

en: The planes arrived one after another.
zh: 飞机一架接一架地到达。

en: One plane after another took off.
zh: 一架飞机接一架飞机地起飞。

en: It is certain that the plane will reach there on time.
zh: 飞机肯定会准时到达那里。

en: I saw a plane.
zh: 我看到一架飞机。

en: I saw an airplane.
zh: 我看到一架飞机。

en: We watched the plane until it went out of sight.
zh: 我们看着飞机直到它消失在视线中。

en: The airplane climbed sharply.
zh: 飞机急剧上升。

en: If planes are dangerous, cars are much more so.
zh: 如果飞机很危险，那么汽车就更危险了。

en: Please stay seated until the plane comes to a complete stop.
zh: 请保持坐姿，直到飞机完全停止。

en: Seen from an airplane, the island looks like a big spider.
zh: 从飞机上看，这个岛看起来像一只大蜘蛛。

en: Small hills look flat from an airplane.
zh: 从飞机上看，小山丘看起来是平的。

en: Seen from the plane, the islands were very pretty.
zh: 从飞机上看，这些岛屿非常漂亮。

en: Seeing these islands from the airplane, we thought that they were really beautiful.
zh: 从飞机上看到这些岛屿，我们觉得它们真的很美。

en: We enjoyed a grand view of the Alps from the airplane.
zh: 我们在飞机上欣赏到了阿尔卑斯山的壮丽景色。

en: The plane flew over Kate's house.
zh: 飞机飞过了凯特的房子。

en: I saw five airplanes flying away like so many birds.
zh: 我看到五架飞机像许多鸟儿一样飞走了。

en: An airplane is flying overhead.
zh: 一架飞机正在头顶上飞过。

en: The universe on the earth is constituted of atoms.
zh: 地球上的宇宙是由原子构成的。

en: It is in the nature of birds to fly and build nests.
zh: 飞翔和筑巢是鸟类的天性。

en: I can no more predict the future than I can fly.
zh: 我无法预测未来，就像我无法飞翔一样。

en: Look before you leap.
zh: 三思而后行。

en: Some fish fly.
zh: 有些鱼会飞。

en: There are also fish that fly.
zh: 也有会飞的鱼。

en: You shouldn't skip in reading.
zh: 你不应该跳读。

en: The greater the genius, the longer it takes the world to find it out and understand it.
zh: 天才越大，世界发现和理解他的时间就越长。

en: Mahatma Gandhi, the apostle of nonviolence, was born in 1869.
zh: 非暴力使徒圣雄甘地出生于1869年。

en: Non-violence is the first article of my faith.
zh: 非暴力是我信仰的第一条。

en: I had an artificial insemination by donor.
zh: 我做了人工授精（供精）。

en: It is you who are to blame.
zh: 该受责备的是你。

en: It is he who is to blame.
zh: 该受责备的是他。

en: Where's the emergency exit?
zh: 紧急出口在哪里？

en: Call the police in an emergency.
zh: 紧急情况下请报警。
